intro: Seseli tragioides, commonly known as the prickly seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. It has a distinctive appearance with its spiny stems and clustered inflorescences. Seseli tragioides is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
